website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive way to protect yourself and your home through hands-free, automatic lighting. A high-quality, economical motion sensor and the best bang for your buck.
pros: A light socket sensor that provides light when you enter a room and turns off when you exit
cons: Sensitivity can be hampered if placed too close to another object

customer_reviews.title: Sensor sensitivity fades after use.......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August 2016 and it worked great for months, it was responsive to motion from a good distance and I was very happy with it. I would have rated it 5 stars after a month of use. However, in the past two months the sensor aspect seems to have gotten worse and literally now I have to wave my hands very near the sensor for the light to go on.This is not what I paid $20.00 for and this should not be happening after 8 months of use. I am very disappointed and at this point would not recommend this product unless you don't mind getting inches from it and waving your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: motion activated light sockets create RF interference
customer_reviews.text: I bought four. The product worked as intended from a motion detection turning on lights standpoint, but using two of them in my garage caused our RF garage opener to stop working intermittently. After researching the problem learned the sockets might be causing interference so I removed the sockets and presto the garage opener works 100% of the time. Started wondering if new static we getting sometimes on our Panasonic wireless portable phones was related; removed the other two sockets from hallway ceiling fixtures and presto the phone line static has gone away. Don't use this product if you have concerns about possible radio frequency interference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garage motion light combined with 3-bulb LED splitter is perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I connected this in my garage to a 3-way bulb splitter, three different places in my garage. It works fantastic. Now I keep my light switches always turned on in the garage and anytime someone walks in, it lights up the 3 LED light bulbs, automatically shutting them off after a few minutes of no motion. This is the splitter product I used:  And these are the LED bulbs I chose:  In 2020, I upgraded the light bulbs to some Barrina T5 LED tubes. You can link up to six per light socket. I used a little adaptor that turned the bottom of this motion sensor into a light socket. Loving this setup even more. The sensors have been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: jmueller

customer_reviews.title: Limited range, 4min light, non adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: The box says a 12 foot radius but usually i have to get really close to the light before it turns on. I have it mounted 10ft high in my garage where I just walk by and a light there is very convenient. I would say for my installation and use, it's more like a 6 foot radius. See my video. Easy to install, screw on bulb, screw on to socket make sure it has power. The sensitivity is not adjustable, nor is the time of light. Which is fine for my use, I just wish it had more range in the sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: P.Kersey

customer_reviews.title: Became unreliable and then started tripping circuit breaker
customer_reviews.text: I used two of these in my laundry room. I loved them at first, but as time went on, they began failing. First, they wouldn't always turn on promptly. Next, they started not shutting off. Then, they would turn on randomly when no one was in the room. (I could see light shining from under the door to the laundry room. Lastly, they started tripping the circuit breaker in our electric panel. I removed them and the circuit no longer trips. I used these for nine months. Disappointing. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: sensitive sensor, great response
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this item for my tool room and it works like a charm. The motion detection is pretty sensitive and just as the door is opening or im clearing the doorway the light turns right on. I have not had any issues with the sensor and i have no complaints. I have enclosed a video that shows how quick the light turn on and the range- im not even in the room when it does turn on.
customer_reviews.author: veritech_13Top Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of them, and the lights would come on when there was light from the window. No over-ride for daylight. These work for about three weeks, then stopped working when it was completely dark. Tried to process a refund, and was told that they were out of warranty. Tossed both of them, This was a complete waste of money...
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Always Come On
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use in my basement laundry/storage room. One of them didn't always come on when I entered the space. I then bought one made by Maxxima for replacement and moved this one to my walk-in closet. Same issue of sometimes it worked and sometimes it didn't (even when I waved my hands). The Maxxima one has never failed to work. The other one of these that I also placed in the laundry/storage space seems to work all the time, but it is further away. It might be that this one isn't good for close up while the Maxxima one is.
customer_reviews.author: DRD

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty basic install. Didn't work. Couldn't get it to light up no matter what. I would remove it, screw the bulb back in the socket, and see light. Then I would kill the power, install the First Alert, add the bulb, and turn back on the power--to nothing. No matter how long I waited, no matter what I tried, no light. Sadly, I threw out the packaging yesterday (to the curb) and waited until today to install, so no way to return it without a box, so that money's lost.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have installed it in my garage and it is working as expected. I have also added a Y splitter to run two bulbs of this and both the bulbs are working with no issues. In fact when i open the garage door, the light turns on due to motion of garage door which means i get a lit garage even before garage door is fully opened which is what i need. The bulbs turn off after 4-5 mins of no motion.
customer_reviews.author: Ash Ban

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty simple to install. Just screw it in. Screw in a light bulb of your choice (pay attention to the maximum wattage specified in the instructions) turn on the light and it works as described. Turns on the bulb when I'm about 12' from it and turns off approximately four minutes after not detecting any motion. Makes the lighting in our unfinished basement much more economical as we don't have to worry about forgetting to turn off the light.
customer_reviews.author: johnbg

customer_reviews.title: Works with Incandescent, CFL's and LED lamps !
customer_reviews.text: Just FYI, all. Package states: OK for Incandescent to 100 Watts, CFL to 50 Watts, and LED to 16 Watts (1600 Lumens). Works great for my ceiling bulbs in my 9 foot basement. Turns on at about 12 feet away, as advertised. Getting a couple more, and returning the Luxon-made units.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have many motion detector devices in my house. I like putting in motion detecting switches, but a lot of my closets and garage don't have powered switches (which you need for motion detecting switches). This product is a simple alternative. I have one in my garage and one in my children's closet. It takes away the aggravation of always having to turn off the light after they leave them on. This product is simple, screw it in, screw in a bulb, ready to go. It stays on for four minutes after motion stops being detected. This time cannot be changed. It is nice in that it can't be messed up, or need to be reset in a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really convenient and aides in safety
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product it works extremely well detecting motion and Added an element of both convenience and safety and illuminating in frequently used to spaces like side storage rooms throughout my home. And I never have to worry about forgetting to turn the light off and having it on for days until it’s noticed. From that aspect alone this product will pay for itself over time.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: These were quite cheap and I wouldn't have minded if they didn't last forever. I have three of them and two of them are perfect. One seems to occasionally trigger on but not switch off. In that case I have to physically switch the light fixture on and off to 'reset' it. They are all in the basement, an area I frequent so I normally spot the dodgy one pretty quickly. I have low-voltage bulbs in the fitting so running costs aren't much of a concern. Overall I'm happy and would replace or add to my needs with these again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Won't Work in Small Room
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our laundry room so that the light would come on whenever the door was opened at night. Sadly, it doesn't work. Apparently when installed in a ceiling fixture, it's too high up to "see" the door open. We ended up buying a fixture from the local home improvement store. Can't return this because we didn't try to install it within the return window... only got to the house last week thanks to Covid-19 travel restrictions.
customer_reviews.author: B. Geddes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install but not good for shallow closets
customer_reviews.text: Great product for open space like basement or garage Does not work well in 2’ deep closet I bought this for my 3’ deep pantry closet Not sensitive enough in short distance Easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST THING I'VE BOUGHT IN AGES! SAFETY FIRST!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! Now the second I open my back door to enter garage there is a chorus of angels and let there be light! I can't believe I didn't get this thing years ago, because of a few bad reviews. It was easy to install and works beautifully within my 10-11 foot range. Stays on for four minutes, so don't panic! I tested by watching from afar, and it's right on time, so my electric bill will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Herner

customer_reviews.title: poor at sensing motion, doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: These come with a 3 year warranty, and mine just barely made it past 3 years of light use before it died. When it worked, it was ok, but you had to wave your arms to get the darned thing to detect the motion. WAY, WAY too expensive for something that's this poorly made. So much for First Alert. I hope their smoke detectors work a lot better than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Madigan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!! Installed 3 of these in our stairway and unfinished portion of our basement. We only have one switch for the light in the stairway and the others are pull chains, and now we don't have to worry about the lights staying on all the time if someone is in the finished area of the basement and trying to turn them on when carrying stuff. Much easier than trying to wire multiple switches and adding additional lights to the current switch.
customer_reviews.author: luvbigdogs

customer_reviews.title: Turn on fast and effectively most of the time...
customer_reviews.text: This motion sensor is working alright. I bought 4 of them and have been using 2 of them over a year. The sensor triggers the light to turn on fast and effectively most of the time. However, sometime there are a few seconds delay if the movement is so fast tor the sensor to catch. Also when you're in the area for a long time, the light will turn off and it will take the sensor up to 30 seconds to reset, just a little inconvenient. For these flaws, I give it a 4 stars, otherwise, it would've deserved a 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: AZshopper

customer_reviews.title: They work very well
customer_reviews.text: This is my third set of these over the years. The second set still works but I felt that they be getting weak so wanted a back-up. I use them in my garage - nice not having to flip a switch every time I enter from my back door. The only downside is that when you are working in the garage, they sometimes do not sense enough movement and turn off, leaving you in total darkness. A wave of your arms will remedy that.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it works
customer_reviews.text: Have this device in my utility room so when I go out to change laundry the light will come on automatically . Sometimes I find myself waving my hand in front of the sensor for it to turn on and other times it won't even come on at all ( I noticed this is when its cold out) but regardless it doesn't get below 40 in my utility room due to a heater . I still enjoy this over not having it , just would be a lot better if it would come on everytime correctly .
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Not for closets...
customer_reviews.text: So, the problem is that there is really no downward motion detection. We put it in a closet and it just can't sense anything without a hand right in front of it waving incessantly. If you want a motion sensing system that's needs to see you coming from either directly horizontal to a maximum of 45 degrees than this might work. Other wise, you should pass.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works well when it does.
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered 5 of these for my basement and garage. Four out of five work as expected they detect motion from about 10-15 feet away. They pick up movement from my two girls who are under five feet tall as well as it does for me at over 6 feet tall. The one unit will turn on when the switch is on but does not turn off. I have tried it in various other sockets and with a multitude of bulbs (compact florescent, LED, traditional filament). Nothing seems to work. Disappointed in that fact otherwise I would have perfect coverage.
customer_reviews.author: Joe G

customer_reviews.title: Lacks 360 degree awareness
customer_reviews.text: I put this in a typical garage ceiling, needing it only to monitor about 110 degrees rather than a full 360 degrees due to walls. Initially its effectiveness missed several degrees of motion for about an 80 degree response range. Over only a couple weeks of use, that range appears to be narrowing drastically, allowing you to take several strides in full view before it reacts- giving the appearance of monitoring maybe 50 of the 360 degrees. I shouldn't have to, but I will try minor rotations of the unit in its socket to see if I can move its blind spots.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C

customer_reviews.title: Works for me, wife hates it
customer_reviews.text: Works well for me, my wife is tiny and likes wearing hoodies and she swears it never activates for her even waving her hands around in the air. Activates when I step into the garage, sometimes quicker as I'm about to walk in. Helps having auto-light when carrying the baby or something else. Not as energy efficient as using the light switch on/off, but it sure is convenient!
customer_reviews.author: G.C.

customer_reviews.title: Not fully 360
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well enough, but due to an obstruction from garage door framing, it took me a few times adjusting, testing to get it to respond well to entering from outside. The sensor has 3 major areas of detection at 120 degrees apart, and I had to turn it slightly for best sensitivity. I have used them on the 2 sockets on my garage ceiling, and interestingly the further one detects me entering from house quicker than the nearest one (I have swapped them out with same result). It should work well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Martin H.

customer_reviews.title: Love This Light for Our Garage
customer_reviews.text: We put this in our garage and now leave the light switch on all the time. As soon as we open the door from the house to the garage, the light comes on. You can tell it is off when you start to ope the door and see it illuminate as the door opens a little wider. My wife and I are very happy with how this device works. If we had light sockets instead of light fixtures in our closets, I would put them in there as well.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Works well for about 15 ft overhead
customer_reviews.text: I installed at top of stairwell for basement stairs (13 steps). The sensor routinely picks up motion when door opens at top and comes on. However it’s usually about 4 steps up from the bottom before it picks up motion and activates. But from basement floor to light in stairwell is 21 feet. I’m ordering another to install in the basement hall that should illuminate the hall and bottom 5-8 steps. Pretty certain this will solve my problem and keep me from having to fuss at the wife for leaving these lights on all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky H.

customer_reviews.title: this thing works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: One of my pet peeves is leaving lights on while not in use. With 3 kids, this is a constant issue. I purchased this product to use in my garage to kind of test it out. Man, this thing works like a charm. Love it. I might not be able to ever make the kids remember to turn the light off, but with this I don’t need to. Open the garage door, light comes on, leave the garage and in a few minutes it goes off. No more leaving the light on all night! I plan to buy several more.
customer_reviews.author: SWJerome

customer_reviews.title: Hands Free Perks!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a home where in most the closets and pantry or storage rooms, lights automatically come on when you enter. Not everyone has that convenience built in. This is great for my father who could use that same treatment when walking into rooms or especially the dungeon of a garage where the laundry room is. Otherwise he is fishing around in the dark looking for the pull strings. No issues with this so far.
customer_reviews.author: House Manager

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: First of all, Amazon fyi, USPS delivered my original package to a neighbor on Sunday 11:40am as your system stated, I couldn't find it anywhere. After I called again on Monday, the neighbor brought it over Monday night. Tx for fixing USPS's error. Back to the product, after 24 hours it works like a champ. I put it in a tool room in my basement that doesn't have a light switch, now rather than walking 6 feet in the dark to find the light chain, the light goes on upon opening the door! Well done!
customer_reviews.author: User - Private

customer_reviews.title: I use it in my garage and it does not do good with picking up heat or movement.
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my garage that has a 10' height. I aligned it to where when I step into the garage the 180 degree side is pointed right at the garage door from inside my house. It's about 8' from the door. I sometimes have to jump and wave my hands around to get it to turn on. I wish it would pickup better. I would not order or recommend this to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: EBC

customer_reviews.title: not instant-on
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because it isn't instant-on. it sometimes takes one or more seconds to react and switch on the LED bulb we're using it with. would have preferred to use a wall-switch mounted controller, but the position of the switch wouldn't allow for it. shorter members of the household - under 4ft tall - don't seem to trigger the sensor, but the angle of entry is very close to the fixture so it's acceptable to us. if the room or hallway you plan to use this in doesn't have a lot of 'sideways' room, you may find this device to be unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: D-n-J

customer_reviews.title: Works well, stays on for 4 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a walk-in closet that had a pull-string switch. It is easy to install and has alignment arrows to improve the sensitivity for your application. The light comes on very quickly and stays on while I am in the closet. The light stays on for 4 minutes each time. I am happy with this socket.
customer_reviews.author: RE-View

customer_reviews.title: Defective and packaging had clearly been opened before I received it
customer_reviews.text: It was obvious, a cut down the side of the thick plastic package that it had been opened prior to me receiving it. I think customers have a right to know they are purchasing a previously opened and possibly used product. On top of it all, it doesn’t work unless you wave your hand in front of it. I think I received a defective product that someone else had already returned because it was defective
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Sensor light is great
customer_reviews.text: I had a device very close to this one and have had it for about 25 years! But alas the dark covering has eventually become brittle and doesn't always sense my arrival. I used it on my covered porch by my front door Yes I know it is not for outdoor use but it has pretty much good overhang to protect it from rain. This is almost exactly like the one I had before and it works great. As soon as I come up to my door the light comes on and stays on for about 4 minutes more than enough time for me to get into the house. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine A Delfino

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised !
customer_reviews.text: as soon as it was installed with a led bulb it worked as advertised and hopefully for a long time cause it was installed on a high ceiling that I needed to use a tall ladder ... no more long cords to pull on to turn on light
customer_reviews.author: E. Cornier

customer_reviews.title: Very annoying. So
customer_reviews.text: I gave it three stars because of the problem with the motion detection. I have two of them in my garage. If you drive in or walk in, it detects the movement and the light comes one. However, if the light goes out while I'm in the garage, I have to jump up and down, wave my arms, shimmy, shake, and bust a move before it detects my movement. Very annoying. So, if I'm going to be in the garage working, I usually remove it...also annoying. Looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Robelix

customer_reviews.title: The motion detection works pretty good. As long as you take note of ...
customer_reviews.text: The motion detection works pretty good. As long as you take note of the sensors and you position the socket accordingly to pick up motion in a specific area, it will work great. At first the product was not picking up the motion how I would have liked but after adjusting the socket, everything is working to my expectations. I have the socket inside our walk in closet so as soon as we walk into the closet or open the door, the lights come on automatically.
customer_reviews.author: jzun223

customer_reviews.title: Burned out after 18 months of usage.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item in August 2, 2015. It died in early January 2017. It seemed like it was burned out due to the smoke stain on some of the plastic covering. We placed this item in garage and was a great tool for us. It lasted for about 18 months. Wished it could have last longer. If anyone can suggest other items that is similar to this, which sense motion 360 degrees and lasts longer than 18 months, please let me know. However, we will purchase another one of this since there seems to be no replacement as of yet. This is an okay product and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AnakManis

customer_reviews.title: Decent replacement for garage door opener lights that keep coming loose
customer_reviews.text: Works good if you remember that it has an hourglass shape detection and anything off the sides is greatly reduced. Also have to account for anything hanging from ceiling or the garage door in both up and down position. I was able to get it adjusted close enough for what I needed and now just a matter of how long the detection lasts.
customer_reviews.author: MRC

customer_reviews.title: Works great ... for a short time
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through 3 of these over the last 5 years. At first they work great. Then eventually they stop working (usually takes a little over a year). Sometimes they stop working because the bulb has burned out and takes the sensor down with it. (When the bulb is replaced the sensor never works again.) Other times it is not the "bulb's fault" but the sensor just stops turning on or off ... or does nothing. Eventually I gave up on this motion sensing light socket and abandoned the idea of having one in the basement. Too bad. When it works ... it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Yensid Maven

customer_reviews.title: Great for the garage
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device that I use in my garage since our garage door opener doesn't have a light that automatically comes on (a newer unit too!). Works very well and it activates when I walk through our internal door and when the garage door opens from the outside (meaning it senses in polar opposite directions just fine). Suits my needs perfectly- my only complaint is that sometimes it takes a few seconds before activating. Sometimes I'm 3-4 steps into my pitch-black garage before it turns on. Not a big deal, just not instant. That being said, I know it does better when there already is some existing light. Would still highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Romanos

customer_reviews.title: This is The One!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the one to buy. I bought the second most popular and it doesn’t even compare. This thing is hyper-sensitive from further distances. Day or night. I actually like the fact that it stays on 4 minutes tbh. I don’t need need any adjustments myself personally. As a big added bonus, this truly looks like a security camera in real life. So, even when it’s off, it’ll discourage many would- be thieves. Just saying. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Chow :)

customer_reviews.title: Great for the garage!
customer_reviews.text: These motion sensor outlets are totally great! We tend to leave the light on in our garage, especially when we carry stuff in from our vehicles (and we forget to turn the light off)...this where these are excellent! Installing them is like screwing in a lightbulb...literally. I installed two of them in our garage and once we open the door to head out to garage, the lights automatically come on. No need to remember to turn the lights off since after a few minutes after coming inside, they shut off! I've been wondering where else I could install these in our house! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: TomC

customer_reviews.title: Just as described!
customer_reviews.text: We needed this for the garage. It is great to walk into the garage and the light comes on for us. Often times hands are full and the last thing I want to do is put everything down in order to get to the switch. It stays on plenty long enough! There no longer is forgetting to turn the lights off in the garage. I am going to be buying more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sensitive enough
customer_reviews.text: The motion detection is not sensitive enough. It often fails to detect me when I walk into a room. I often have to wave my arms around to get noticed. It also can't detect small motions so if I sit for a while, it turns off. It works worse in cold weather because your clothes are more insulated and give off less IR. Also it's too expensive. I recommend buying a light bulb with IR built in since they aren't even more expensive than this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I have it in our laundry room, which is lit by the same switch as a our stairs light into the basement. Don't need that on all the time unless we're in there - quickly detects that we walk into the laundry room and turns on. Stays on the whole time that we're in there detecting our motion. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: BrewMN

customer_reviews.title: Quality built & lasts!
customer_reviews.text: I recently made this purchase to solve the problem of my dark garage. (The opener light never works.. It's old so it vibrates the bulb loose within days, even the specialty bulbs.) Even though my other garage light is right above the opener, the field of view works for my motion (opening the door to the house and the garage door). I purchased this product (same brand) OVER 10 YEAR AGO for my dark walk-in closet since I'd usually find my hands full and it is STILL going! My cat can trip it occasionally, but I don't mind...it lets me know where he's been. :)
customer_reviews.author: Anissa J.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: This was actually hard to find. This was a replacement for the exact same motion detector socket from First Alert I got ears ago. I use this in the garage. It stays lit for about 4 minutes when sensing motion. Paired with an LED light bulb, it should last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JP7570

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for dark rooms with pull strings!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed for the basement and installation couldn't be any easier! I put two of these on the unfinished side of my basement where we store things. I often found myself either struggling to find the string in the dark or trying not to drop something while pulling the string. As soon as I open the door, both lights go on and I can walk out knowing they'll turn off in a few minutes. I have to take the strings down as my family keeps forgetting they do not have to turn off the lights anymore. I'm hoping I can install these in my attic. My husband loves to leave those lights on too.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Saves energy and turns out the light when no one is doing laundry.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the First Alert PIR725 Motion Sensing Motion Activated Light Socket to regulate when the downstairs laundry light turns off and on. Before installation people would leave the light on sometimes overnight. Now the light turns on when you come down the steps and remains on for four minutes after everyone leaves the basement then turns off.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected!😳
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. It wasn’t good at motion sensoring in my garage. I had to walk in a pretty dark garage to stand “right under” the light bulb in order to get the light on. It didn’t make sense and I returned this product. I bought a motion sensor bulb instead which works great.
customer_reviews.author: CAMILA

customer_reviews.title: A bit sensitive, and turns on during daylight
customer_reviews.text: My complaints are personal preference, but this is too sensitive (sees motion too easily), and the fact that it turns the bulb on even during daylight means I got the wrong device for my needs. If you don't care what time the bulb goes on, this will work fine - but I also needed something that only turns on if it sees motion *AND* if it's dark out.
customer_reviews.author: Mason J. Rourman

customer_reviews.title: so good.
customer_reviews.text: This is intended for ceiling mount and has a directional sensor aiming down. Unfortunately, I did not find this out until after I had the sensor. They do not advertise it for such, but I have it pointing upward in a lamp on the floor to give light in an office where the light switches are on the opposite side of the room by another door. I do not have a ceiling lamp socket available. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Function as promised
customer_reviews.text: The electrician recommended these to us. They are expensive, but much less expensive than running electrical wires to install a second switch (we added a second door to a room and wanted to be able to turn on the lights from that door as well). Sometimes you have to be in just the right spot for the motion detection to work, but once we learned that, all is good. You also have to keep moving for the lights to stay one, but again, that's doable. All things considered, these do the job and we are pleased. (Have had them for at least three months.)
customer_reviews.author: ReaderBaker

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Have another I've been using for quite sometime. Needed another one for other room. Works great. Unlike others that stay on for 10 or more minutes after you leave the room, these stay on only around 4 minutes or less after leaving.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Functional but finicky
customer_reviews.text: Certainly allows you to avoid searching for the pullstring in the dark and reaching for the light switch with your hands full, but the claim that it has 360 degree coverage not quite right. In the closet, you have to to certain point before it come on, and in the hallway it will sometimes come on right away and at other times not want to come on at all until you're leaving the area.
customer_reviews.author: Frank DLT

customer_reviews.title: Owned since 2011, works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Feb 2011, still going strong. Simple and effective. I'm a smart home aficionado with lots of smart devices but this "dumb" device is staying (and adding 2 more) for those places that Alexa can't hear me.
customer_reviews.author: pro geek

customer_reviews.title: light with motion detection
customer_reviews.text: What I liked was that the light goes off after a very short time if there is no motion and it keeps my cost of electricity down. It does not pick up the motion as stated but if I switch on the light switch it comes on and then goes off once there is no motion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brainless Installation, Turns On/Off Appropriately
customer_reviews.text: I have this screwed into the ceiling light socket on my enclosed front porch, which does not have its own light switch. It works great anytime there's motion on the porch. It turns off several seconds after you leave, so it doesn't seem to waste energy. I was worried it would go on anytime someone moved inside the house, but it does not. It also doesn't light up for people walking up the pathway even though the sides of the porch are glass. So it depends on what you want it to light up, I guess. I'm not sure what the range is or whether it "sees" through glass.
customer_reviews.author: DogsInSeattle

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2 - only one worked properly
customer_reviews.text: The first one worked perfectly. The second one has me waving around my arms like a mad-person to get it on - tossed it. Pretty shoddy workmanship on the build quality - good enough for a broom-closet but not much else.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kidman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work very well. I was concerned because I bought it for my garage, where the light socket is about 10 feet from the ground, but it has no problems at all and senses motion perfectly. I paired it with a 150-200watt equivalent LED and it works great to light up the whole garage.
customer_reviews.author: John Adinolfi

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable for us!
customer_reviews.text: I installed in the bathroom for my elderly mom and sometimes work, often doesn’t and she has to flail her arms and even that doesn’t always work. I installed in my laundry room for me and usually doesn’t turn on and it’s right over my washer. Not happy! Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dina CMC

customer_reviews.title: Very practical product with good response, not over-sensitive
customer_reviews.text: These are very reliable. I use one in the laundry room, walk-in closet, both places I enter while frequently carrying laundry baskets. I'm getting ready to put one up in the stairwell to turn on automatically when we approach the stairs. It's very nice that it also turns itself off after a short time of no movement. Very practical product with good response, not over-sensitive. Used them for years - this is my third one.
customer_reviews.author: MountainTime

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Adding Light to Garage
customer_reviews.text: Got this to add light to my garage. Works nicely to add just enough light to get around without tripping over things when getting to my car or letting the dog out. I wish it had a slightly larger active area, but I can take a few steps into my garage and wave my arm around to get it to activate. I thought it would activate when my garage door opened, since it is within the quoted active area, but it doesn't. I does turn on as I start pulling the car into the garage though, so I guess that's good.
customer_reviews.author: A. Person

customer_reviews.title: Works well when we walk into the garage....
customer_reviews.text: I had used two of these for many years, but one stop working so I decided to try some motion lights in lieu of using this item. The motion lights were not as responsive in our garage ceiling thus my order for two more. So far, so good. Hope I get as much wear from these as I did from the first two.
customer_reviews.author: Damma

customer_reviews.title: Awesome range great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, installed it in our basement and no long have to walk across a dark area to find that pull chain in the total darkness. As soon as I open the door into my utility room, boom instant light! Goes out if there isn't movement around 90-120sec. Definitely don't use anything over 100w bukb because it will overheat and shut itself off as a safety.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Only randomly sees movement
customer_reviews.text: We use this product in the garage where the door is about 10 feet away and at about a 15 degree angle from the ceiling outlet. No matter how much i wave my arms, this product will not light up. Unless of course it randomly decides to turn on AFTER I dance in front of it. It is basically useless, because in order to get the light to come on, I have to reach for - and turn off and then on- the light switch! Poor quality! We've only had it for about 6 months. It has never worked well.
customer_reviews.author: M Humber

customer_reviews.title: It Solves My Problem
customer_reviews.text: This units works, unlike another design I checcked. I bought this one to replace one of the same design that worked perfectly for years. I hope this one does, too. I would have given it another star, but the unit I got looked to have been handled.
customer_reviews.author: MIKEEXEK

customer_reviews.title: Motion sense is good, power control is not.
customer_reviews.text: Motion detection works great in my situation. What doesn’t work great is the power controller on the inside. Every single time it senses motion, the light flashes randomly for 15-20 seconds then stays on fine. Almost like when the starter is going bad on a fluorescent lamp ballast. I currently have led lights hooked up, but also tried using incandescent. Same results with any light bulb configuration. I will continue to test different configurations in the hopes that it’s something I’m doing wrong...
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, Update: works now!
customer_reviews.text: This was placed indoors in dark dry area so when you open the door the light comes on. It replaced a pull chain. It "worked" for one day, the power to the light appeared to be affected as the bulb worked but was dimmer than normal. Now the light just stays on and does not go off. Would like to give zero stars but can't. Update the motion on part of this device now works by placing in a different light bulb, however, the light is dim. I am going to try different lightbulbs over the next few weeks and will update, upgrading to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Alfa

customer_reviews.title: Works, But Only Time Will Tell If Cost-Effective
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a 7 ft ceiling light socket above my laundry area in the basement. So far, it's been working. At $20 a piece, only time will tell if the investment was cost-effective. I've had this for about 3 weeks now, and so far it's been working flawlessly. I also bought the iRainy E27 LED infrared motion detection light, which cost me $10 to compare. That one has been installed above my children play area in the basement. That has also worked well so far. Just waiting to see if the products are durable or not. Some comments say the product will stop working after a month or so. I'll come update this review if that happens to me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sun

customer_reviews.title: Love this light.
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry I took so long to review this product. I bought this in may. I have feral cats in my back yard. I thought this would last a month, with the constant off on. It is still going strong, just have it for extra protection, to maybe scare off burglars, if they are not scared of cats. I love this light. I have never actually tested it as to how far it senses motion, but I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Meenooone

customer_reviews.title: Easily Installable Motion Detector Light socket
customer_reviews.text: This motion detector light socket is replacing a First Alert motion sensing light socket that lasted for 9 years. I hope this one will be just as good. This product seems to be not as sensitive as its predecessor. I wish there's a way to adjust its sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: ReyT

customer_reviews.title: Great way to save power
customer_reviews.text: I put these in my kids bathroom almost 10 years ago and they are still going strong. I love that they will just turn off the light after 5 min. Makes auto off lights easy for areas kids are in and don't turn lights off themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Mn poet 09

customer_reviews.title: Don't last particularly long
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these and over the 7 years I've had them the all or most of them have stopped working. This often before the light bulbs they hold need to be replaced. First time probably was within a couple of years, but I thought it was a fluke. They failed slowly enough, and with the failure mode leaving the lights on in the basement, that I didn't reach threshold for leaving a review until now.
customer_reviews.author: subtractswell

customer_reviews.title: Good Product This is my 6th or 7th one of these over many years for several locations
customer_reviews.text: This is my 6th or 7th one of these over several years. The current model works well with both CFL and LED bulbs. Over the years they have not lasted more than 4 or 5 years, somtimes failing completely when there is an electrical outage or surge. However, I have tried other brands and/or knock-offs and they failed to detect the motion as well and did not operate well with CFL or LED bulbs. Make sure that the ceiling outlet you are using is not controlled by a dimmer switch. The product doesn't swivel, doesn't adjust for sensitivity, BUT IT WORKS.
customer_reviews.author: Always A Critic

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a garage!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Just screw it in where the bulb goes then screw bulb into it. Turn on the light and leave it on. That’s it. Works great. I have this in my garage so that if my hands are full I don’t have to fiddle in the dark to turn my lights on. Light turns itself off after awhile. Very fast shipping. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful replacement for my old sensor. We keep our inside garage light on all the time. And these allow us to walk from the house into the garage without ever having to flip a switch. They seem to be able to "feel" the inside door opening and immediately kick the lights on inside the garage. Great technology, have no idea why it works so well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Turns the light on for you, and off when you forget
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a basement stairway where the light was on a pull chain. Screwed this into the porcelain bulb socket and now whenever we walk down the stairs the light goes on. 4 minutes or so later, the light goes off. I'm seriously considering getting a few more of these to put in the low traffic areas where you don't want to worry about whether you turned the light off
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: one works better than the other
customer_reviews.text: It works MOST of the time, but on several occasions, I had to waive my arm for a second to get it to light up. I bought 2 of these for my garage, one works better than the other. It’s just OK.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: worked good for only a month
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing at first. Worked every time. We use it in our garage. But in the last few weeks it has had issues more and more often. It has not been touched or adjusted any different but now sometimes we have to get halfway through our garage before it comes on and sometimes it doesn't come on at all. I was incredibly impressed at first and now, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works well indoors.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I initially planned on using this outside but it is NOT suitable for the outdoors. The motion sensor film cover is very flimsy and easily removed. Therefore, I now use it indoors and it works just fine. The sensor is sensitive and provides light in the dark as soon as I get near the stairs, which was my plan.
customer_reviews.author: Vivica

customer_reviews.title: Detection range is horrible
customer_reviews.text: You almost have to be standing under the light for the motion detectors to work. I installed 4 in my garage and an extremely dissatisfied. Actual wired motion light fixtures are probably a better option.
customer_reviews.author: fargo288

customer_reviews.title: Although they both snap to attention and switch on like a couple of soldiers
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for our large high-ceilinged garage. Although they both snap to attention and switch on like a couple of soldiers... one of them lingers on for an interminable length of time (possibly like a drunken sailor- to offer up another tired military metaphor) and doesn't switch off until unscrewed. I swapped the two detectors, and tried them in the other sockets and the problem continued, so it seems like a malfunctioning device rather than positioning. I'd actually rate one of them a five, and the other a one, so I'm ending up with a three rating for the two of them together.
customer_reviews.author: zardac

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable and long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: The last one I had lasted around eight years so no complaints here. Easy to install and NEVER broke down or did not keep light from coming on ever. Always worked. Eventually, after eight of constant use in my basement near the washer and dryer, it wore out but everything dies at some point. I wish I could get eight years out of everything I buy.
customer_reviews.author: harleyjet2

customer_reviews.title: Works OK but is a little slow to respond sometimes
customer_reviews.text: I have this set up in my basement workout room so that the light automatically comes on when I enter the room. It is a little slow to respond from time to time but otherwise works great. It is limited to lower wattage bulbs (a 200 watt bulb will not work in it).
customer_reviews.author: D. MILLS

customer_reviews.title: It does the job but it ain't beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: I can't really get too excited about a motion detector light thing. I have two of these in the basement near the mechanicals and the laundry. They come on perfectly when I enter the area. Since they are big and not terribly attractive, I wouldn't use them in areas where you care about appearance, but they work well! No complaints. I have no idea if you will save any electricity expense with the auto turn off of the bulb after a period of time since they need electricity to be on guard for movement, but it's probably better than leaving the light on. I'm happy with it in limited areas of the house and garage.
customer_reviews.author: Georgie

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Sensitivity
customer_reviews.text: Sensitivity is inconsistent at different angles of approach. I tried to turn and keep the most sensitive side towards my door, but I still have to wave my arms within 5 feet of it to trigger sometimes. Maybe it's the DC humidity or something. Works enough to keep it - hoping it'll be more consistent in the less humid months.
customer_reviews.author: BoMan

customer_reviews.title: unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, but the latest model degrades over time (1-2 years) and becomes useless. I bought one of these about 10 years for my basement laundry room and that old one is still working. A new one I bought about a 1.5 years ago is failing and doesn't turn on until I'm 2 feet away. The warranty is 3 years. I contacted First Alert customer service about the problem and they sent me a replacement, good customer service. I really don't want to have to contact customer service and request a return or replacement. I just want the item to work over time, like the old ones. 2 stars-not reliable over time.
customer_reviews.author: Hilda

customer_reviews.title: Works But Only With One Side
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the closet to make it easier so when you open the door, the light comes on. Makes sense, right? The sensor works but it seems to be only half working as the other half of the sensor does not notice motion so I must wave my hand on the other side of the closet to get it to turn the light on. I would have bought more if not for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: OK but....
customer_reviews.text: It's in my garage, and when I am working on my workbench, it can't detect motion and it shuts off every four minutes. I know, it's supposed to, but in my case, it's irritating as hell. If you are always moving close to it it will stay on. I just have the wrong thing for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This this is very sensitive. We bought it for a light that is outside but under the center of a carport so it is out of the weather completely. The carport is about 30 feet long and this is in the center. The light comes on whenever anyone gets within about 5 feet of the carport. We put a bright LED light out there and it works great. But it is very sensitive and has great range. The timer is about 4 minutes too.
customer_reviews.author: W. K. Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Great for attached garage
customer_reviews.text: I have an attached garage with laundry out there. We go to the garage all the time and hate getting over to that switch. This was a little expensive for what it does I thought but wanted to try it out. Spent the $19.00 and had it shipped prime. It installs as easy as screwing in a light bulb and works great. It's quick too. I've see some motion sensors take awhile to register and switch the light on. Not this one. Almost instant as soon as my door opens into he garage. I'm impressed. Very nice. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install, good sensor range
customer_reviews.text: Great solution to finding an indoor motion sensing light solution. Thought I was going to have to purchase an outdoor flood light or install an expensive switch/light. Just plugged this in to the existing bulb socket and it works great. Good distance on the sensor and goes off without wasting electricity
customer_reviews.author: sortasmart5891

customer_reviews.title: No more "Did I turn that light off? " worries.
customer_reviews.text: No more worrying about turning the lights on or off in the garage and laundry room! These work great and stay on just the right amount of time after motion is detected. Great for areas where you are just in and out or even if you are going to be there for a while, as long as there is movement every 4 minutes! Plus you can put what ever size or type of bulb you want in them.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought this sooner. I put it in a basement storage area that had the old school chain hanging from the light fixture. Now instead of tying to find the cord in the dark the light just turns on by itself. It senses me every time without a problem. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Titanium

product_meta.title: First Alert PIR725 Motion Sensing Motion Activated Light Socket
product_meta.description:
Color:WhiteAdd motion-sensing capabilities to any existing indoor light socket with the First Alert PIR725 Motion-Sensing Light Socket. This motion-sensor light socket offers 360-degree motion detection and has a sensitivity range of up to 12 feet when mounted 8 feet above the floor, making it perfect for walk-in closets, garages, attics, basements, and stairways. Designed to work with incandescent bulbs up to 100 watts and compact fluorescent bulbs up to 50 watts, the motion light socket provides automatic, hands-free light operation and automatic shutoff that work in both day and night conditions.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Motion Sensing Light Socket, CF compatible. The First Alert motion sensing light socket screws easily into any existing light socket. Patented motion sensing technology automatically turns light on when entering and off when exiting the room. Senses movement in all directions. Ideal for laundry rooms, basements, walk-in closets and garages. Works with incandescent bulbs up to 100 watts or compact fluorescent bulbs up to 50 watts. 3-year limited warranty.
